intro: Berkheya multijuga, commonly known as the multijugate goldball, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow, spherical flower heads that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Berkheya multijuga is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
